DOC.detailed_description: This study randomize , control trial cardiopulmonary exercise self-management intervention improve functional capacity , health related-related quality life , reduce health care cost medically fragile , elderly patient chronic obstructive pulmonary disease ( COPD ) heart failure ( HF ) . Specific aim include : ( 1 ) To determine benefit combine outpatient/home-based exercise , self-management program function al capability ( daily activity , six-minute qalk distance , symptom ) , ( 2 ) determine effect exercise/self-management quality life , health status , cardiopulmonary function , gait balance , ( 3 ) test theoretical self-regulation model mediate effect major outcome variable , ( 4 ) compare health care resource utilization expenditures intervention usual care group order conduct cost-effectiveness analysis program . The primary outcome upon study power functional capability measure daily physical activity . Outcomes measure three time point : entry follow intervention 6 12 month . Two-hundred ( 100/group ) recruit VA Puget Sound Health Care System outpatient clinic . The study carry four year . Inclusion criterion include standard criterion severe COPD HF , optimal medical management , willingness participate outpatient exercise/self-management program , work phone , hospitalization HF , COPD , related illness past two year least two outpatient visit past year . Exclusion criterion include unstable disease recent surgery , supplemental oxygen requirement rest 4 LPM , already participate regular exercise three time week , inability ambulate , uncontrolled mental illness , alcohol drug abuse life expectancy le one year .
